page.title: 10THE WORK ON THE A47 BYPASS
page.content: The A47 road in our area used to continue through Blofield. One of our staff lives near where they were re-designing the{by-pass.}She told us that the scheme started in 1981 and finished in 1983. It took that time because in winter the ground was too wet to move and lift. They kept the {traffic}moving fairly well while they did the work, she did not have to use different routes. The{machines}were very noisy and if you had a window open in your house you could hardly hear yourself speak. There was dust flying about everywhere too. She was very glad when the work was finished. The scheme cost over Â£1,000,000. It was important because the A47 links {Norfolk}to the{Midlands.
